New Records: Fakhar Zaman made history by smashing the fastest century for Pakistan in World Cup history.
Key Match Events: Pakistan defeated New Zealand by 21 runs via DLS method in a rain-hit game.
Fakhar Zaman played an unbeaten knock of 126 and was well-assisted by Babar Azam.
Rachin Ravindra scored his third century of the ongoing World Cup with 108 off 94 balls.
Kane Williamson scored 95 off 79 balls, sharing a 180-run partnership with Ravindra.
Mohammad Wasim was the pick of the Pakistani bowlers with figures of 3/60.
Glenn Phillips, Mark Chapman, and Daryl Mitchell scored brisk runs towards the end to help New Zealand's cause.
Pakistan were set a revised target of 342 off 41 overs due to rain.
Fakhar Zaman and Babar Azam added 194 for the unbroken second wicket stand.
Fakhar Zaman took the attack to the New Zealand bowlers, smashing four sixes and as many boundaries in his 39-ball fifty.
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson remarked that Pakistan deserved the result and praised Fakhar Zaman's performance.
Fakhar Zaman expressed happiness about the 'do-or-die' nature of the game for Pakistan and considered his century one of his best.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play multiple times, affecting the match conditions.
New Zealand made 114 runs in the last 10 overs to set a challenging target for Pakistan.
Shaheen Afridi became the most expensive Pakistani bowler in World Cup history during this match.
